summary: The Coast Guard Improvement Act of 2025 aims to establish a Secretary of the Coast Guard, appointed by the President and confirmed by the Senate, to oversee the Coast Guard. The bill amends existing legislation (Homeland Security Act of 2002, Title 10 & 14 of the US Code) to define the Secretary's powers, responsibilities, and reporting structure, and clarifies the roles of the Commandant and the Department of Homeland Security in relation to the Coast Guard. It also mandates a reorganization plan within 30 days to facilitate the transition.
